semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Asymptomatic Individuals Who Test Positive for COVID-19
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Chapter 1: Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > g. Coronavirus infections > 1. COVID-19 infections > h. Asymptomatic individuals who test positive for COVID-19

content.full_text: For asymptomatic individuals who test positive for COVID-19 and there is no provider documentation of a diagnosis of COVID-19, query the provider as to whether or not the individual has COVID-19. A false positive laboratory test is possible, and it is the provider's responsibility to confirm the diagnosis and document accordingly. (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)
content.summary: Establishes protocol for handling positive COVID-19 tests in asymptomatic patients without provider diagnosis documentation (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)
key_concepts: Provider query requirement for asymptomatic positive tests (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)
False positive test possibility (Evidence: pg no: 31, L36)
Provider responsibility for diagnosis confirmation (Evidence: pg no: 31, L36)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Query provider when asymptomatic individual tests positive without diagnosis documentation (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)
detailed_rules.explanation: When an asymptomatic patient has a positive COVID-19 test but the provider has not documented a COVID-19 diagnosis, the coder must query the provider to confirm whether the patient actually has COVID-19 (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify asymptomatic patient with positive COVID-19 test
Step 2: Check for provider documentation of COVID-19 diagnosis
Step 3: If no diagnosis documented, query provider for confirmation
Step 4: Wait for provider response before coding

specific_codes.context: Only assign after provider confirms diagnosis

coding_scenarios.scenario: Asymptomatic patient presents for routine screening and tests positive for COVID-19
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient asymptomatic, COVID-19 test positive, no symptoms reported
step_by_step: Step 1: Review documentation for COVID-19 diagnosis
Step 2: Note absence of provider diagnosis despite positive test
Step 3: Submit provider query regarding COVID-19 diagnosis
Step 4: Code based on provider response

correct_coding.sequencing: Cannot code until provider confirms diagnosis
correct_coding.rationale: Provider must confirm diagnosis due to possibility of false positive test (Evidence: pg no: 31, L36)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot assign COVID-19 code without provider diagnosis confirmation
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding based solely on positive test result without provider diagnosis

warnings: False positive laboratory tests are possible (Evidence: pg no: 31, L36)
Do not code COVID-19 based solely on positive test without provider diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)
best_practices: Always query provider when diagnosis documentation is missing (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)
Wait for provider confirmation before assigning COVID-19 codes (Evidence: pg no: 31, L36)
common_mistakes: Assuming positive test equals confirmed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 31, L34-L36)
Coding without provider documentation (Evidence: pg no: 31, L36)
tips: Provider responsibility includes diagnosis confirmation and documentation (Evidence: pg no: 31, L36)
implementation_notes: Establish clear query protocols for asymptomatic positive cases
